website_summaries.verdict: No more wasted space or clutter in the shower or tub with this hold-it-all organizer.
pros: Tension pole fits spaces 5 feet to 8 feet
Four self-draining baskets adjust to any position along the pole
Attractive satin nickel finish is rust-resistant
cons: May damage the ceiling if installed with too much tension
Some customers complain of rust at pole joints

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be less satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was not understanding correctly when I read the instructions "cut 4 in. from tube B" and proceeded to try to place this minus 1 piece (which made it 2 inches too short) and then plus one piece (which made it about 15 inches too long), but apparently that is exactly what I'd have to do to make this fit. Am I the only person who bought this who doesn't have access to metal tube cutting tools? How does the company expect that I have that equipment just lying around? Couldn't be less satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great basket designs!
customer_reviews.text: I buy one of these things every year, due to rust and buildup over time. This is by far the best one we have purchased. The baskets are perfect to keep bottles from falling over. The only thing I would add is hooks for loofahs. However, I used shower curtain hangers to add hooks. I am very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Put it together in less than 10 min and looks very nice. Plenty of tension to hold lots of stuff. Almost too much tension but was fine w/ me bc that's the reason I bought this. The previous one wouldn't hold tension any longer. I like the baskets bc I think it's inevitable that this type of caddy won't be perfectly level forever. I also like the L-shape design of the baskets as I think it will help prevent balance issues. The instructions were very easy to follow and the addition of the tape over the seams is a great idea. Overall, I'm very pleased w this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JT9

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price! No tools needed if you use pennies & tape.
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! Face up the rounded edge of the rubber pieces to make life easier while putting on the shelves. You don't need to cut the bars if you simply use the shorter length then add taped up pennies the bottom of the spring bar. Be sure to add a few inches more than needed to create tension. My ceiling is about 81-82" & I didn't use any tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Looking for a addon hook?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! I got tired of bottles always falling off of my teak caddy with shelves, and went hunting for one with good secure baskets. This has done the trick! The pole is stable, the baskets keep my items in place, and it looks nice. The one down side is that it has no hooks for loofas and the like. But don't worry, I've found the answer! These s-hooks can be easily added to any of the baskets so I have a place to put my hanging items. (Note: This review is for the 2130 model with the squared L-shaped baskets. The 2132 and 2125, which are also on this product page, have a different design.)
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice way to get shampoos and body washes out of the way. Adds shelf space where you otherwise wouldn't have it in the bathroom. Works by tension and you can move the shelfs and tighten where you want them. Sturdy also
customer_reviews.author: Ms. L

customer_reviews.title: Read Full Item Description
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item and am glad I did. The first statement in this item's description is "EASY TO INSTALL: Fits in corner of tub or shower, with no tools needed for installation". That is completely false. They require you to cut the steel rod in order to fit for some ceiling heights. Unfortunately for me, I did not read the full description thoroughly. Somewhere in there it does state that this may be necessary. I would recommend that they mention this earlier on in the item description and to not advertise it as "no tools needed" since that is clearly not the case for all of their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Papaya_Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but annoying to get setup
customer_reviews.text: So far the product is working. In the directions I was instructed to cut 11 inches off one of the pipes. I did this and it was still very far from fitting properly, I cut off an additional 4-5 inches and got the product to fit in my shower. I wish I'd read the description before hand because it does say cutting is required, but this was an annoying additional step. I wouldn't buy this again and would opt for something that is a one size fits all solution
customer_reviews.author: Tristan

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my shower neat and tidy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thankful my tub to ceiling height measures 81" and I used the B & B and spring pieces for this to work with no cutting. This shower caddy holds a lot! After clearing everything from the tub edge so I can can take a comfortable uncluttered bath, there is still space left in the shelves. Time will tell how well this lasts, but for now I am VERY happy with my much more organized tub! I do which it had loops or hooks for loofahs or razor, alas I can fit these items on the shelves themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Worst item ever
customer_reviews.text: This item is the cheapest piece of crap I have ever seen. the directions actually tell you to CUT the metal in order to make it fit your shower. It's made with maybe $5 in material at most. I thought I was buying a tension rod, but it turns out I was just sticking a half inch tube inside a 1in tube with a spring inside. I ended up having to take my skill saw to cut the tube in order to get it to fit my shower, and I just have a standard tub shower with an 8 foot ceiling. Whatever you do, don't buy this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Gurley

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, would be better if aluminum
customer_reviews.text: We've had this for over 4 years now. It's held up well and holds a lot of shampoo, soap, etc. The only problem is it's made from steel, which is a problem for a product that sits in a wet environment. After 4 years there is now a lot of corrosion. I'm waiting for it to collapse. We live in on the East coast, which is fairly humid. Plan on a lifespan of about 5 years for this shower caddy, maybe a bit longer if you live in a drier climate.
customer_reviews.author: J-Dog

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting may include hacksaw but worth it for the sturdyness...
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut off about 11 inches of the main support pole in order to fit the area between my tub and the ceiling. It was easily done it a small hacksaw. Once installed I was content with the appearance and the room in the trays provided for my menagerie of bath products and tools. It was also one of the most economical choices offered. Worth more than what was paid.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: PIPE CUTTING MAY BE REQUIRED!!!
customer_reviews.text: The caddy seems to be made well, however the assembly was horrible! We have a tub with an 8’ ceiling, so instead of including shorter pipes the kit requires you to cut the pipe. We had to cut the pipe 2 different times. Luckily, I have a sawzaw just laying around! After that fiasco, the caddy finally fits. However, the spring loaded top pushes the Unit off of the shower corner. So be prepared if you are OCD, it is NOT a snug fit into the corner. We’ll use it for now and I’ll see how long it lasts, but if the assembly is any indication of the lifespan and future quality, I’m not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This shower caddy is excellent. It replaced a very old rickety one and it looks excellent in my ugly shower (needs repairs). The corner design makes it fit well in my shower and the deep basket holds my bulk bottles of shampoo and conditioner very well. I got the nickel design as that one looks like it had the least problems from all of the options from this seller. The caddy is sturdy, was simple to assemble, and I can see it lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CHOICE
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a shower caddy and it took me a while to decide which one to purchase. This is the one I landed on and couldn't be happier. The setup is super easy! Plus the position of each shelf is completed customizable. Its very secure and locked in place. Very well built and seems like it will last a ago time. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Useless and Bizarre
customer_reviews.text: I thought my husband was kidding me when he said that to assemble this product he had to find metal cutters and chop 11 inches off of one of the main support tubes. What?! Yes, to assemble the shower caddy may require such bizarre prep. Not having metal cutters or a hack saw/miter box at the ready, we are returning this useless product. The instructions were confusing,too. Why would a company think that a consumer would have specialty tools to build a simple product? I wish I could give this zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: jennscomm

customer_reviews.title: Not a 10 Minute Installation
customer_reviews.text: This shower caddy is sturdy, made well, and looks good once installed. However, the directions should tell you that for a tub, one of the tubes needs to be cut at least 4 inches! I worked on this for 45 minutes and re-read the directions and it wasn't until the last page did it mention that one of the tubes should be cut to fit a bathtub. Once you know this, and cut the tube; it's easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: LuLuBelle

customer_reviews.title: Know you might need a hacksaw!
customer_reviews.text: Now that we have it in the shower, it’s great. I thought that it was going to be like an extendable shower rod, kind of a one size fits all. Not the case. It comes with several pieces of pole to put together, so you MIGHT not have to make any cuts at all by just eliminating a section of pole, but you might need to. Maybe my distance was non standard? At least the directions are clear about measuring and cutting and assembling, but it would have been nice to know about that possibility in advance. We had to go buy a cheap hacksaw to make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: liz

customer_reviews.title: One of the best I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Prior to buying this, I had my shampoo & soaps around the tub and on the towel bar. Now it's all in one place and so much neater and easier to clean around. I like that the shelves are "V" shaped because you don't feel like it's taking up space. It also came with sticky tape the same silver color to put over the seams to protect them from moisture. Great feature. Silly to say but I'm thrilled!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Tooley

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: We have had this in our shower for a couple of months now. It works great. Since it is a small shower, I absolutely love the design of the shelves so that it minimizes the amount of space the shower caddy takes up, but still allows for plenty of storage. We debated the Satin Nickel and the Bronze and price point was important enough we went with Satin Nickel and it looks GREAT. We may purchase a second one for the other shower...
customer_reviews.author: Tired Mom

customer_reviews.title: Was missing a saw, and the rubber isolators.
customer_reviews.text: I installed this one, and realized that I had to adjust the height of the bar - and the only way to do so is by sawing off a piece of it. They do not provide a saw - not even a basic one. I did not have my tool box handy and used a sawtooth mini knife that comes with a wine opener. Took me about 10 minutes to cut through - only tells me that it used really cheap material if a wine knifey can cut through. Also, there are rubber pieces that supposed to go between the bars to prevent leakage - and there were missing.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsinnersoul

customer_reviews.title: I really like it!
customer_reviews.text: Watch the video to help with setup. It is at the end of the description of the product on the Amazon listing and is helpful. This is a good product. I'm not sure why so many people are complaining about having to cut the pole. I did it with a hacksaw in under 5 minutes. (female) Obviously ceilings and tub/ shower heights are all different. I like mine a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Marilynn B.

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for assembly were vague, it's already rusting around the wire joins forming the basket and I've had it for 2 months, and it was not easy to install. The basket levels are incredibly tricky to get just so, and you may have to cut, yes, cut, the metal pipes to get it to fit exactly right. For a temporary fix, a first apartment, etc, this would be okay, but don't waste your money if you're looking for a long term solution.
customer_reviews.author: Ashleigh Blandin

customer_reviews.title: High quality product, I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Product was not super easy to assemble. Luckily I do maintenance for a living so I had a saw to cut the metal pipe down to the size it needed to be. if you buy this item you will need to have a saw to cut metal to get it to the right length you need it to be this is a guaranteed thing they should have it in there description but it is a very high-quality piece and it holds up well and holds many items.
customer_reviews.author: pcgeek

customer_reviews.title: It's a very helpful gadget
customer_reviews.text: I'm leaving one star because the packaging was damaged, there were no instructions enclosed and it was missing parts. I understand I ordered the "returned" item for a few dollars less, I just didn't realize this meant half-assed. I wish I'd ordered for the full price and got all the necessary pieces to make installing this shower caddy simple and complete. Ingenuity won the day with a rubberband to hold up one of the shelves and the foot of a crutch to provide stability.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hyrum Savage

customer_reviews.title: Who in their right mind designed this?
customer_reviews.text: I opened this product and measured the distance I needed the pole to be. However, in order to make this product fit with the distance, the instructions say I am required to cut 5.5 inches from two of the tubes. This is completely deceptive marketing, nowhere on this product page nor the company website does it ever acknowledge this. The rod is NOT "adjustable", it literally has a set of different lengths and if your shower does not fit those lengths their instructions are to get out your power tools and cut the metal tubing. Absolutely horrendous design!
customer_reviews.author: RJW

customer_reviews.title: Decent Caddy. Inaccurate Assembly Instructions.
customer_reviews.text: In theory this tension pole caddy was a good buy. It's only after you attempt to put it together that things start to fall apart. The assembly instructions inaccurately specify how much the included poles need to be shortened to fit within your designated placement area. That's assuming you have a saw capable of cutting through the metal poles. While the caddy appears to be well made, the dismal instructions included with the product don't do the caddy any favors. The shipment should have arrived with a bottle of aspirin to take for the headache you'll get trying to put this together.
customer_reviews.author: PGN

customer_reviews.title: so annoying to build
customer_reviews.text: warning- this thing is very annoying to build. the shelves don't stay in place and the poles don't stay together unless its actually put into place, so every time you pick it up to try to get it in place the shelves fall and slide and all the poles come apart. Also, and this was not clear before purchasing- you have to cut one of the poles depending on your bathroom measurements. If I would have known that before I never would have bought this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lakritz

customer_reviews.title: Seems Like A Quality Product So Far
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving this 4 stars because I've only just put it together and put it in the bathroom. I don't know if it will last. The last one we had was a different brand and your standard configuration. It lasted 3 years without an issue and I expect at least the same out of this. I like this because it hugs the wall but still gives you a lot of space for your shower items. Fit perfectly in an 8'3" space between the top of our tub and the ceiling. Easy to put together.

customer_reviews.title: Some were great, some were horrible
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews on this. Some were great, some were horrible. most of the bad were because of rust, so I picked the nickel type that wont rust. The installation was kind of a pain and the spring mechanism did not work at all. My length was 65.5". I think what they did was give me the wrong model (the poles for the taller systems). Keep in mind no matter what you have to cut some of the poles w/ a metal blade hacksaw. You'll need that. Wouldnt secure into my fiber glass walls very well.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip L. Salamacha

customer_reviews.title: This may require you to cut the steal pipe
customer_reviews.text: It was a sheer pain to assemble this product. It says assembly requires only 10 mins, but, it took us almost 3 hours to assembly this. If your distance to ceiling is less than 71 inches or more than 80 inches then you are required to cut the metal pipe. Are you serious?? Do you expect your customers to have a metal cutting tool lying around their house. Fortunately, we had miter saw but still we were not able to make a proper cut and we had to use hammer to push the other pipe into this trimmed pipe. If you feel this product is worth your time and efforts then you can go ahead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I saw some mixed reviews. However, I think the instructions are simple enough to follow and I was able to purchase a hack saw right here on Amazon for about 6 dollars and even adding that, this product was by far still the best priced. My shower is about 85” which did require me to cut one of the rods-but, with the hack saw it was easy peasy. Assembled easily and it freed up a lot of space in my little shower. Would buy again, would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.....
customer_reviews.text: So I receive this, looks great, get the instructions out, check all parts, measure the space it's going to fit in, get everything ready to go. Then I read the chart to see which combination of poles to use for the height of my space from tub rim to ceiling.......and I see it. "Cut 12 inches from Pole B". SAY WHAT???? I'm an older woman with limited handyman skills. How the f*** am I supposed to cut a piece off a metal pole??? So packed it all up and back it goes. Very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: HurKate

customer_reviews.title: Keeps products upright and organized, love it and have used for around a year.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shower organizer and bought one for my mom as well. I think the baskets are the key, they don't allow the products to fall all over the place. I see reviews where folks had difficulty with assembly but I just figured it out, I didn’t even read the instructions. I just chose the poles that when fit together would allow for the tension rod to fill out remaining space. Maybe I got lucky with it?
customer_reviews.author: hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable  huh?
customer_reviews.text: I guess my definition of adjustable is different from the manufacturers definition of adjustable. It's only adjustable after you measure your area, then cut the piece down to the size that you need. Once that's done, you only have that size going forth, so if you move and measurements are different, good luck
customer_reviews.author: CMoan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality !
customer_reviews.text: Very very poor quality. When trying to put spring inside and push rods together to assemble the thin walled tubing split! The included instructions are very poor as well. They have measurements on which tubes to use but they are incorrect. If you have specific height in your shower you are instructed to cut tubes to length.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Could have included everything...
customer_reviews.text: There's no suction soooooo...the suction didn't suck i guess. The box didn't include the little dohickeys to keep the shelves up on the pole. Also didn't include the rubber parts for the top and bottom. Nor have they contacted me after an email and plenty of time to respond. So all in all, might be a great product if it were able to be put up. Idk
customer_reviews.author: Tc

customer_reviews.title: Just what our small bathroom needed
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a new 2 bedroom apt recently. What I did not pay attention to was the lack of storage space, and that's an understatement. I needed something for the shower fast. No more shower caddy over the shower head. This product is perfect. After 3 weeks it is still being supported strong in the corner of the shower by the coils. There is plenty of space for both my husband and mine shower needs, however my husband still wants his own. At the price, and quality I don't mind at all! Now, to get him to put the small shelf up for a few towels and toiletries.
customer_reviews.author: renamarie54

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit as indicated
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. I have a pretty standard height shower/bathtub (68 inches) and this product requires you to cut part of the tubes off for that height! I had to bring it to my parents' house to borrow their hacksaw and vise. I cut 4 inches off, just as specified in the instruction manual. Brought it home and it's still NOWHERE NEAR fitting into my shower! Maybe if the instruction manual were accurate I wouldn't be so frustrated, but now I have to drive all the way back out to my parents house and then just hope it fits when I get home. Absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hope you own a hacksaw for an "easy assembly" item
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a deal of the day ... needed more space for my tub and this was an "easy" assembly 10 minute or less item.... total bs. its not 10 minutes or less and its certainly not easy if I have to have a hacksaw to cut 11" off of the tubing. Can't return it either... total disappointment and waste of money. HACKSAW does not equal EASY ASSEMBLY in my world. I'm trying to see if the bf can do it if not its a trash project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It serves it's purpose. For the price of the thing it works and looks okay. You won't find better for the price. That being said, this probably won't be a long term solution for us and will need to replace with something a little better when this one gives out. UPDATE 1-15-19 Just threw ours out. Lasted about a year and a half before it rusted out and needed to be trashed. Longer than I expected to be honest. For the price, it is a good short term solution but I would recommend another product if you're looking for anything long term.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Have to cut poles to make it customized.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon clearly states that this is a tool free assembly and that no cutting of poles is required. That is NOT true. Once received, the instructions state that if your shower falls within a certain height, you DO have to CUT the METAL poles. When I contacted customer service, they did not believe me.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Ankerbrand

customer_reviews.title: Bad instructions and still need to cut it
customer_reviews.text: I've put several of these together over the years so didn't really need the instructions. Thank goodness cause they are rubbish. Several reviews said 'no need to cut this one'. Of the 4 shower caddys that I've had over the years, this is the only one that I've had to cut! Elevated bath to the 7 foot ceiling. Have a hacksaw ready!
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow Unicorn

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I just put mine together and so far my impression is that it's a piece if crap. The poles don't fit snugly together so the whole thing wiggles back and forth where the poles come together. And on of the baskets doesn't sit right on the pole, so it literally tilts upward and as of now seems unusable. I actually haven't even put anything on the shelves yet because I am afraid it's gonna fall. And what am I supposed to do about the wonky basket?
customer_reviews.author: L. Gardiner

customer_reviews.title: Cheap AF
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the money. 1. POOR QUALITY It’s a lot cheaper in person than it seems from photos and description. I just set this up and I doubt it’ll be sturdy enough to last in my shower. 2. ASSEMBLY TIME The box says 10 minute assembly time but it took forever to assemble because the directions were horribly written and not descriptive. The directions require you to cut the poles depending on the size you need, completely defeating the purpose of a tension pole. So have a hand saw ready if you purchase this item. I would not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down👎🏽
customer_reviews.text: This product was so impossible to put together. I literally pulled out my shoulder and almost cried 4 times during assembly. It is completely unlike the ease of which the how to video suggests. The baskets do NOT easily slide over the rubber pieces. I just left the baskets anywhere i could get them to grip. Thus, i have 3 pretty low on the pole and 1 that’s too high. The rubber parts are half sticking out from the basket but it seems to be staying. None of the pieces, such as the end caps, are in good condition. They are all misshapen. Spend a little extra money and avoid the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Damaged packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Package came damaged. I was worried something might be bent or broken. Also, it looked like somebody had tried to open it before. (See photos) Put it together by myself in a reasonable time. It almost fell apart while trying to install it, but once installed it feels sturdy. It also comes with matching thin tape to put over the seams of the poles to prevent rust. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time or money.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely wouldn't have bought this if I had read thr reviews more in depth. YOU NEED A SAW TO CUT THE METAL POLE to the size of your shower. The directions are super hard to follow and nothing is really labeled, its all on you to figure it out. Its been sitting in the box for weeks just taunting me, I do have a saw, but the whole idea of spending 3 hours putting together a $20 shower caddy is annoying. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: Gets rusty! Really rusty
customer_reviews.text: Our whole family liked the shape and sturdiness if this product. However the rust resistance the manufacture boasted about lasted less than 6 months. By 12 months the rust was so thick that it was coming off in the shower and has had to be cleaned up daily. It is at each connection point. We tried to clean it off , but the amount of rust is too much. So now at 16 months we are.rwacing with a Titan brand that actually guarantees to replace if it rusts. Can't recommend.this product if it goes in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: LBW

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: The L-shape shelves are the way to go! Easily holds liter bottles of shampoo/conditioner. I added a couple s-hooks to hang loofahs. It's very sturdy and the finish is holding up beautifully. Adjustable shelves are great to accommodate different heights of our family.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Burris

customer_reviews.title: A saw?
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t realize the installation would require a power saw. Turns out, I have to cut part of the tube off for it to fit. Seems like that’s the job of the manufacturer, Ya know, to make products that are consumer friendly. Might as well just make my own! Really frustrating. I thought this would be a quick fix for my cluttered shower, womp womp.... I bought it a month ago and it’s still sitting in the box and the return window is closed. Junk. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brynn

customer_reviews.title: I like it! Preferred over any that I’ve seen at Walmart or Target
customer_reviews.text: Using in our bathroom that only 2 grown adults use, one who of which has a LOT of bath products. Easily put together, no cutting required in our tub/shower combo. No rust seen yet. Holds a good amount of weight. Looks pretty also!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap! I bought this thing because it was inexpensive. I suppose I was an idiot and did not check out the description a little closer to know that if your space is just so many inches, you have to get a hack saw and saw one of the middle spacer pipes to a certain length. I don't even own a hack saw! The instructions for set up online seem so simple. Yeah, try doing it yourself.... not so easy. I finally just took it to the dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews where the buyer said they could not install the pole due to the tension. It does have a very strong tension but this is what you want to keep the pole in place. I am a 71 year old disabled ex-construction worker. It was tough but I got 'er in place.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the buy so far
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: After about 6 months, this caddy started falling apart! It did not last long, and I will not recommend this product. ********* We needed a pole caddy for storage corner, we have a very tight shower space, and this work perfectly. It took sometimes to setup and adjust with what we wanted, but it worked. It has been standing strongly for more than 2 months, and I don't see any rust anywhere. I am pleased with the buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Yessie Susanto

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't going to leave review, but the shipping for this return is way too much money. $11 shipping return charge for an $18 purchase. Anyways, this thing is complete junk. I'm gonna have to hack saw a pole to get this thing to fit in my shower. I suppose I could just not use one of the poles, but then I will only be able to use one of the baskets (dumb) unless I shorten the other poles too. I'm sure there's better options out there than this product. I
customer_reviews.author: HutCHU

customer_reviews.title: Requires extra steps and cutting
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is you get what you pay for. The first issue I had with this product was that once it was assembled according to the instructions provided the shelves would give way . To top that if you need the full length of 8ft you will need to trim 4-6 inches off of the extension 1/2 pipe. Also once I got it put into place the springs tension was so tight that the spring gave out and the assembly collapsed . Overall I would recommend going with a more expensive shower caddy
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive & works well
customer_reviews.text: I measured 81” from the top of the bathtub to the ceiling. The instructions, I kid you not, to cut off 11” from a pole. I do not own anything that can cut metal. I attached the two poles, slid the springy pole in & put it up. I skipped the short pole. Fit perfectly. It’s sturdy & I like the baskets.
customer_reviews.author: angipate

customer_reviews.title: Hated It!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shower caddy a few months ago & it's sitting in a corner because it is too much work. After putting it together, I found out it needs to be cut so that it will fit into the shower. I would say DO NOT BUY. There is too much assembly & how on earth could someone think that the customer will want to cut anything? Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Had to cut the tube.
customer_reviews.text: My bathroom is standard size maybe a shorter ceiling than the average but regardless I had to cut the tube. Not a little piece but legit more than half of the tube. Meaning I had to wait to put this on my bathroom till I actually went somewhere to cut it cause I do not have something to cut medal. I found it very difficult. The rubbers that you place the shelfs on fall at random. If I was bob the builder i think i would have liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Valmarie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: If I could express dissatisfaction in two words I would say “Zenna Home”. I don’t think I can send it back quick enough. The rubber grips to retain shelves are flimsey and the shelves keep wanting to move during installation. After finally reading and interpreting the manual I finally got it assembled. I tried incredibly hard to get this into the corner of the shower but alas, 2 inches too tall!! This thing does not work. Don’t waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: Pieterse Family

customer_reviews.title: good shower caddy
customer_reviews.text: I like this shower caddy pole thingy, it was easy to put together and easy to install - and it didn't put a hole in my ceiling like the other one I bought. I like the L shape baskets and although they are the normal type of setup with the rubber ring thing, so far the baskets are staying in place without issue. My only complaint is there should be some hooks on at least one of the baskets. Overall, if you are looking for a nice shower caddy for a decent price, I think this one is pretty decent.
customer_reviews.author: glittergirl

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless you have a HACKSAW!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this caddy a higher score, BUT....we actually had to buy a hacksaw to cut the pole to the right length! Don't be fooled by the advertisement - installation is NOT easy. Also, the tension is TERRIBLE. I am afraid to push down on my pump shampoo for fear that the whole caddy will come loose or the basket will break. The baskets are nice and can fit lots of items, and they feel pretty sturdy. But the pole and the installation are a joke.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the purpose but with a stability issue
customer_reviews.text: It works fairly well. Does fine with holding everything that I need to put in it. Also looks very nice and easy to put together. Only reason I did not give it five stars is because it is a little unstable. By no means do I think it is ever going to fall or anything like that, but when taking things in and out it tends to move around quite a bit. This does not seem to have any issue with the effectiveness of the product, just makes it feel a little cheap when it is moving around every time I put something in or take it out.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: We love this shower caddy so much
customer_reviews.text: We love this shower caddy so much! The only reason why we gave four stars is because the instruction isn't very accurate. My husband measured from top of the tub to the ceiling as how it is instructed in the manual and put together the bars (which was for 71-75 inch distance), but it ended up being short. When you install this caddy, don't add the baskets to the pole until the length of the caddy fits your corner of the shower. We added baskets right after we put together the bars, trusting that manual is 100% accurate, and we had to do twice as much of the job to make it finally work to our corner of the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Park

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The baskets don’t sit even due to the eyelids that the pole runs through, they were welded crooked so after running the main pole through, the baskets are slanted in different angles so you’re shampoos and what not will slide towards the middle or slide outwards, other than the fact that the only thing holding these baskets up are little pieces of rubber, in my opinion this is a poorly made product
customer_reviews.author: Knife Guy

customer_reviews.title: Overall, a good choice!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this corner caddy to replace one that had the short clamshell shaped shelves (the kind that everything falls over & out of). I did have to get my husband to cut one of the rods to fit this in our shower, so it is not a super quick install for everyone. The instructions tell you how much to cut off with your shower measurements, so at least that's not a guessing game. The L-shaped shelves are very sturdy though & even hold the extra large pump style shampoo & conditioner bottles securely in the taller shelf. We've had this up for a month now & there have been no issues.
customer_reviews.author: A. Craig

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy but easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assembly. Didn't have to cut anything. Doesn't seem very sturdy though, so we will see. I might have to do something else to steady it. The shelves also swivel and don't stay put, no matter how hard I push them into the plastic piece.
customer_reviews.author: karapg

customer_reviews.title: Not fitted for tub to ceiling
customer_reviews.text: First of all it was very difficult to put together. Secondly, they want me to cut metal to fit it to my bathtub to the ceiling... You think it would fit that since that’s what is advertise for. third, I think there was a missing piece because it said two b parts which I didn’t have
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ALL WRONG! We have to CUT OUR OWN METAL POLE TO LENGTH?!?!!?!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our daughter for her dorm room so there was enough storage for her and her roommates. She took it up and now is expected to CUT THE METAL POLE?!?!!? WITH WHAT? Her plastic knife from the cafeteria? The description clearly states that NO TOOLS ARE NEEDED. What is a saw then? if not a tool??? total crap. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Niki Kanagaki

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: We are out of our window to return this piece of crap but I want you all to know, it's not worth your money. We waited to open it because it was for my daughters new bathroom. Most of the small pieces are bent or warped and even if you can get it to stay together long enough to go between the top and bottom of your shower, there's not enough spring pressure to keep it up once you put items on the little shelves. Total waste of money! So annoyed I can't return this smh!
customer_reviews.author: melzie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: So difficult to build. You have to cut the metal rod if you want it at a shorter length. It was incredibly difficult to cut. This makes the item description misleading because tension rods are supposed to be easily adjustable to any height. The shelves are not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Our tub Corner areas were full of bottles and tubes and such. The small over the shower unit was inadequate. I found this. Assembly was moderately easy. It took me about 20-30 minutes to assemble and install it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Durable,Stores all Our Bathroom Soaps Shampoos Etcetera
customer_reviews.text: Over a Year Later Its Loaded Down With Everything Soaps Shampoos, Conditioners , Ladies and Men's Soap and Shampoos Much Heavier Constitution Than department store Caddy, I'm glad We Bought It ! Very Durable. Highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Donald E.

customer_reviews.title: Great short term
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 2 years. Although Southern California has some pretty harsh water I did not expect the amount of rust that started to accumulate after just the first year. I sprayed it with CLR but nothing helps. The size, shape and sturdiness is great but its not worth it unless you plan on using it for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Terrific step for kids doing their part in cleaning up bath time.
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in our corner. Now the kids can reach and put up their own bath stuff and toys. Allows for toys to dry out between baths. Sturdy, attractive, holds quite a bit. Not sure why the instructions have you put the rubber feet on last. This caused the whole thing to spring apart for me and induced many uncouth vocabulary. I managed, but I would instruct others to put feet on before the tension spring. It's tall and requires a lot of pushing to get it into place; that's what keeps it firmly rooted.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shower rack! Fits perfectly in the corner, we removed the last bar because it was too high. Which is pretty cool that you can adjust it to what you need. Downside: the shelf is a little wobbly but nothing major
customer_reviews.author: Marie Molina

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price & missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Tapered ends of tubes are loose when you fit them inside the other tubes so the final assembled pole is not sturdy and bends a little where the poles connect. Only 2 wedges came in the box so I was only able to use 2 wire shelves. No excuse for missing parts. Finish is terrible - rubbed off on our shower when I was installing!! Product includes tape to cover seams where tubes fit together "to protect from moisture". I'm concerned that this is made out of material that needs to be protected from moisture!!
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Nothing in the description is correct. Does not fit standard height, it's either too short or too long and you have to Jimmy rig it to have it fit. Once you get it to get it's not sturdy and the shelves slide down when you add your stuff. Completely worthless and not easy too assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Although it took me a while to assemble this, I have loved it ever sense it has been installed! It stays in place and has no rust, it hasn't slipped and is easy to rearrange.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple, strong, functional. Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together once you read the directions. I am very happy with the construction of the product as well as the functionality. You can move the shelves to any height you want and lock them in place by using the rubber ring.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, Holds a TON of Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, sleek design, holds all my shower stuff! Very pleased with this purchase. I especially appreciate the tape that they include to tape around the seams to keep rust from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Good product if you want a heart attack :)
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this shower organizer.... But out of nowhere at 2am (while everyone was asleep) the shower organizer fell, and brought down the shower curtain pole with it. You wake up to a loud crash and don’t know what to expect!
customer_reviews.author: Kelcia

customer_reviews.title: Practical and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Was exactly what my shower stall needed. And I'm thinking with the holes no more yucky shelves from water buildup. Also the slats are small enough that the shampoo stands up straight and nothing tilts or falls through.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have it in the shower/bath combo and the pole fits pretty tightly, but seems very secure
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my last corner shelves that were rusting. This one has been installed for a few months, and no sign of rust. I have it in the shower/bath combo and the pole fits pretty tightly, but seems very secure. There are 3 shallower shelves and 1 deep one, but the shallow ones have been fine for our shampoo bottle needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Fits a tiny range of ceiling heights.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely limited range of ceiling heights it will fit. My ceiling was within the range where cutting the tube isn't necessary and it still didn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because I had one before that finally ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had one before that finally gave up after about 10 years. So I ordered this one. Now I am trying to put it together and the little rubber pieces that hold the shelves up are split and I am having fits with them. The old one came with O rings which were easier to use and the shelves stayed in place. I will go to the hardware store and by more O rings so I can get this up and begin using it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: A good shower caddy shelf is expensive but this one seemed ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot of shelf space added to our shower but baskets aren't really that big since they are more of an L shape. The color is what was pictured and goes with our bathroom. A good shower caddy shelf is expensive but this one seemed to be a little less than the ones we saw in the store. It's probably our shower but it doesn't fit into the corner that far so it sticks out a good amount. We have tried several times to move it in further but we don't want to break it. For that reason I rate it 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Great product, takes time and elbow grease to install
customer_reviews.text: If you are a small and weak person such as myself, you will need help to install this shower basket. Other than that, this product is great and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chianne_Away

customer_reviews.title: If I was handy enough to have a tool like that on hand I’d probably make a bathroom storage ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as customizable as it sounds. Very little height options unless you follow the direction to use a metal/pole cutter and saw the product! If I was handy enough to have a tool like that on hand I’d probably make a bathroom storage solution myself. Wouldn’t be that difficult to make it more customizable in height on its own. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: ... the shelf shape would make bottoms not fall over like the typical corner until
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to see if the shelf shape would make bottoms not fall over like the typical corner until. Answer is yes. So far I'm finding this so much more functional that most other corner units (of education I've had many). It fits snug into the corner offering the extra support and the square rack shape is excellent. No idea about rust yet. To be aware it fits many heights, but may require you to cut a pole. Annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent enough for value
customer_reviews.text: This is ok, it was easy enough to put together. After installation I realized it bends a little in the center, not very noticeable but its there. Overall good enough quality for price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: awesome product!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the design of this! We bump into it less than the usual "wedge" shape shelves. Holds a lot of stuff, sturdy and easy to assemble. I didn't expect it to be so great at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Q

customer_reviews.title: Good, not Great
customer_reviews.text: We have an 8-foot bathroom ceiling. Fairly standard height. The standard install is too short, so instructions say use the additional rod. When you add the rod, the tension is so tight, the caddy bows out slightly from the wall. The instructions say you can hacksaw the rod to shorter length, but why would I have to cut a product that should work stock for most ceiling heights? Other than that, it is well made and the trays stay in place. Just not a 5-star product. Add an additional, shorter rod and it would be 5-Stars
customer_reviews.author: A Hurst

customer_reviews.title: the pole caddy works great. I have about 7" from the shower tub ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, once assembled and in place, the pole caddy works great. I have about 7" from the shower tub to the ceiling and had to exclude one of the pole segments since it make the entire assembly too long. The tension spring is also really stiff but is manageable enough to place the pole into place. The baskets themselves were easy to place and can be adjusted on the fly no problem. Fully loaded with shampoo bottles, they don't bend or slide, which is great. One of the baskets came slightly bent, but that was easily convinced into the correct shape with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tran

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: I got this model to replace a cady that needed to be changed. I wanted a rack that was both functional and looked good so I opted for this model. I got it on sale so I figured why not try it out. When it arrived it looked nice and pretty easy to setup. Not the case. The spring coil that comes with it is too long. I had a really difficult time trying to install this without scratching it or causing myself any harm. After several attempts and near accidents I eventually used the coil in my old caddy in the new one and voila problem solved. Unless you have pretty high ceilings I'd be wary of this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pozi

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: What a joke! A complete waste of money! I have wasted literally hours of my life assembling this piece of garbage. In theory, it would be great; but it is not adjustable at all and the "spring" in the top section does not work with any type of tension. So...when you get the top (as instructed) positioned at the ceiling and then attempt to fit the bottom of the pole to the tub, the entire unit collapses because the spring does nothing! I am completely disappointed and am sick of returning things I order!!!!! Save yourself a lot of aggravation and DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ann Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: First, the baskets on this are brilliant. They are good size and work perfectly for shower necessities. Deducted one star because the poll and spring are not high quality. The spring pushed through to the inside of the poll and had to disassemble to fix then reassembled.
customer_reviews.author: Draco

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Have bought two now. First one lasted maybe a year or two. Good quality for price! Very sturdy and doesn't fall ever and easy to assemble. Only had to buy another because I use strong cleaners in my shower and it ate at the coating protecting it from rusting, but even at that it took over a year to need a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy once you get it sized correctly.
customer_reviews.text: This shower caddy is great. We had a few missteps when setting it up, including having to cut one of the poles a little shorter to fit our bathtub properly. Don't trust that it will magically span the area it says it can, unless it's fitting tightly, you'll need to cut one of the poles down. That being said, it's held up quite well over the last year, and I don't see any rust.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie C

product_meta.title: Zenna Home 2130NN Shower Tension Pole Caddy, Satin Nickel
product_meta.description: Color:Satin NickelThe Zenna Home Shower Tension Pole Caddy instantly creates valuable storage for bath items in the corner of your shower. With four baskets, including one deep basket for custom storage of tall items, this rust-resistant shower caddy has plenty of room for shampoo, conditioner and other toiletry items. Assembly is easy. The caddy’s adjustable tension pole mechanism allows it to fit in spaces up to a standard bathroom ceiling of 8 feet, 1 inch high. Zenna Home’s U. S. -based Customer Service department is available toll-free (800-892-3986) to answer questions.
feature_bullets: EASY TO INSTALL: Fits in corner of tub or shower, with no tools needed for installation

FITS IN YOUR SHOWER: Tension mechanism allows for easy height adjustment to fit in spaces with up to an 8 feet, 1 inch, standard ceiling height (Note that for ceiling heights from 60 to 70. 5 inches, and from 81 to 91. 5 inches, one of the poles needs to be cut; easy-to-follow instructions are included)
RUST-RESISTANT FINISH: Rich satin nickel finish is rust resistant
ATTRACTIVE AND RUST RESISTANT: Oil rubbed bronze finish looks great and resists rust
EXTENSION POLES AVAILABLE FOR TALLER HEIGHTS: For ceiling heights greater than 8 feet, 1 inch, extension poles are available directly from the manufacturer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars7,231 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
